intro: Erythrospermum monticola var. monticola, commonly known as the mountain erythrospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are typically ovate with a hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, preferring full sun to partial shade.
